page.title: 11BILLERICAY NW Local History.
page.content: {St. Giles Church, Mountnessing This is the one historic building in the area. The church was built in {1150.}The west front exterior is of pleasant mellowed red brick with large S clamps bolted through the wall to the belfry timbers. Round pillars, built by the{Normans,}support the heavy oak beams and the roof. It has a stubby octagonal spire. Interesting artifacts in the church include a{13th century}oak chest, hewn out of a solid tree, a stone carving of a woman with a bridle in her mouth and a large fossilised bone_whalebone or wild elephant? At one time{St. Giles Church}may have served a larger population but now it is used only for a weekly celebration of the Holy Eucharist at 11.15am on Sundays and for other occasional services.
